# Introduction

This vignette explores long-term patterns in American baby names
using the dataset included in the `mycommonnames` package.

# Data overview

```{r}
library(mycommonnames)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
glimpse(names)
```

# Example: name trends

```{r}
names |>
filter(name %in% c("Samantha", "Scarlette"), sex == "F") |>
ggplot(aes(year, count, color = name)) +
geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +
labs(x = "Year", y = "Number of babies", color = "Name") +
theme_minimal()
```

# Summary

The mycommonnames dataset and Shiny app let users explore how naming
popularity evolves over time. For example, Samantha dominated in
the 90s, while Scarlette rose early 20s.
